The effect lasts for the duration, with only the wychlaran needing to maintain concentration.

trait.name: Communal Binding (3/day)
entries: Whenever an ally within 30 feet. of the wychlaran makes an attack, damage, or saving throw roll, the wychlaran may choose to add {@dice 1d6} to that roll. The wychlaran can use this ability no more than once per turn.

trait.name: Unweave (3/day)
entries: The wychlaran can cast {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic} at its lowest level without using a spell slot or any components. Additionally, if the wychlaran needs to make an ability check as part of targeting a spell of the enchantment or necromancy schools, it can add its proficiency bonus to this ability check.

action.name: Shashkah
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wychlaran is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It  can cast the following wychlaran spells:

spell.name: Moon Blade

m.text: a small candy made with wintergreen oil

entries: You evoke a blazing sword of moonlight into your hand. The moon blade is a simple weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a hit and has the finesse and light properties. The blade deals an additional {@roll 2d8} radiant damage to undead on a hit.

Targets struck by the moon blade have difficulty maintaining or casting spells. Creatures have disadvantage on concentration checks made against damage from the moon blade. Additionally, until the end of the target's next turn, targets must succeed on a saving throw using their spellcasting ability to cast a spell, or their spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Placebind

m.text: a drop of water, a plant seed, and an area at least 100 feet in diameter

entries: Over the course of 8 hours, you guide any number of willing creatures in a ceremony that gives them familiarity with the local area. Participants are able to rest or perform other activities during the ceremony, so long as they do not leave the ceremonial circle and as long as you are able to complete a walk along the circle's edge at least once every 2 hours.

Once cast, the effects of the spell allow the participants to use any of their class features or traits that require a specific terrain type, such as a ranger's Favored Terrain or the wychlaran's Place Magic, on the terrain in a 50-mile radius from the spell's casting. The spell's effect encompasses areas above and below ground, but does not extend to other planes of existence.

This spell does not alter the terrain, only the targets' familiarity with it. For example, a ranger with the Favored Terrain of tundra doesn't suddenly find snow in the desert, they simply treat the terrain in the spell's area of effect as favored, regardless of its type. Abilities requiring the presence of specific physical components such as plants or a storm still require those elements.
The familiarity gained through this spell fades when a creature finishes a long rest.

spell.name: Restore Spirit

m.text: firewood, and rare herbs worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a ceremony that cleanses and restores the target creature's'' spirit. The ceremony removes the following harmful effects:

items: Any effect causing the target to be blinded, charmed, deafened, exhausted, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, or stunned
Any curses
Possession
Any reductions to the target's ability scores
Any effect reducing the target's maximum hit points
Any negative effects suffered as a result of casting or being subjected to a raise dead or resurrection spells.
Any effects suffered as a result of Wychlaran Communal Bonding being broken

spell.name: Scatterspray
entries: You target a collection of at least six small unsecured objects located within one foot of each other. The objects can be no larger an apple and collectively weigh less than 25 pounds. You cause these objects to fly off in all directions. Creatures within 10 feet of the objects must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or they are struck by the flying items. If the items are hard or sharp, such as stones, sling bullets, coins, or similar, struct creatures take {@damage 2d8} points of bludgeoning damage. If the targeted objects are softer, such as eggs or berries, the spell deals half damage and creatures who fall to 0 hit points from the attack are not killed, but are unconscious and stable instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shashkah

m.text: a tuft of black wool, a human hair, and a sword

entries: A sword you are holding is imbued with the power of ancient spirits, guiding you in its use. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you are not holding the weapon at the end of your turn.

spell.name: Turn Fiend

m.text: a witch bottle containing salt, an ounce of holy water, and chalk worth 50 gp

entries: You unseal the bottle, and a gaseous mixture fills the air around you. Each fiend of Challenge Rating 1 or lower within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, they are turned for 1 minute or until they take any damage.

A turned creature must spend their turns trying to move as far away from you as they can, and they can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. They also can't take reactions. For their action, they can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents them from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature uses the Dodge action.
At the end of its turn, a turned creature can repeat this saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the Challenge Rating of fiends it can affect increases to 2 or lower. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the Challenge Rating increases to 4 or lower. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the Challenge Rating increases to 7 or lower.

spell.name: Vulnerability
entries: You touch a creature and mark it with a curse of vulnerability. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become cursed. While cursed in this way, the target has disadvantage on saving throws they make to resist your spells.

spell.name: Waterspout

m.text: a piece of grass or seaweed twisted into a coil

entries: You conjure a whirling, cylindrical column of water 10 feet in diameter and 60 feet tall rising up from the ground or a body of water. Creatures within 10 feet of the waterspout must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be sucked into the spout. Creatures in water have disadvantage on the saving throw. Any creature that starts its turn inside the spout takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is grappled by the spout (escape DC equal to your spellcasting DC). Targets are restrained while grappled in this way.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spout up to 30 feet in any direction, provided it stays in contact with the ground or a body of water

default: (a) a {@filter any sword|items|type=martial weapon|property=sword} or (b) {@filter any simple weapon|items|type=simple weapon}
(a) {@filter any simple weapon|items|type=simple weapon} or (b) {@item component pouch|phb}
{@item leather armor|phb}, {@item explorer's pack|phb}, and a wychlaran mask

entries: Caretakers of ancient arcane knowledge, the wychlaran use wisdom and magic to protect Rashemen and guide its people.

entries.name: Spiritual Community Leaders
entries: The wychlaran, or witches as most call them, are the spiritual leaders of Rashemen. They fulfil many of the roles that clerics and druids occupy in other lands, communing with the deities and spirits on the behalf of common folk. Their words are heeded by all, and to disobey one is unthinkable.

entries.name: Knowledge Tempered by Wisdom
entries: The wychlaran are sworn caretakers of ancient Raumathar's arcane knowledge. The empire was known for its battle-wizards, capable of unleashing powerful spells and binding elemental magic into arcane constructs to create great weapons of war. The wychlaran judiciously protect this lore, carefully using these magical secrets in defense of the land.

entries.name: Tradition, Progress, & Heresy
entries: As caretakers of rare magical knowledge, the wychlaran have learned drawing upon divine, natural, and arcane energy in their spellcasting. A secretive few disagree with the conservative use of magic. These "durthans" would use the full extent of knowledge available, including forbidden dark magic, to protect and preemptively strike against the nation's enemies. Wychlaran leaders remain vigilant against such heresy, believing such thinking leads to the same self-destructive path taken by their Raumathari ancestors.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a wychlaran quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Wisdom, followed by Constitution or Intelligence. Second, choose the new {@background wychlaran|rcg} background.

entries.name: Multiclassing and the Wychlaran
entries: If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player's Handbook, here's what you need to know if you choose wychlaran as one of your classes.
Ability Score Minimum. As a multiclass character, you must have at least a Wisdom score of 13 to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a wychlaran.
Proficiencies Gained. If wychlaran isn't your initial class, here are the proficiencies you gain when you take your first level as a wychlaran: all swords, light armor.
Spell Slots. You refer to the standard multiclassing rules for the Spellcasting Feature for the purposes of calculating your total spell slots, with the following adjustments:

items: In addition to the listed classes, add all your levels in the wychlaran class for the purposes of calculating your total level.

Instead of using the Multiclass Spellcaster table, you use the Wychlaran Class Table and cannot gain Spellcasting spell slots beyond those listed. This can result in the loss of spell slots from another class with the Spellcasting feature.
You do not gain any additional bonded spell slots as a result of multiclassing.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Wychlaran spellcasting is a combination of learned knowledge and deep connection with spirits and the land itself. The origin of wychlaran arcane capabilities lies in learned magics such as those practiced by wizards but has evolved over time, and has been tempered with wisdom and passed down in oral traditions and complex rituals. While wychalaren have access to a wide breadth of spells, individuals specialize their knowledge and the rituals needed to form a spiritual connection and change their daily spells are more demanding and therefore more limited on a day-to-day basis. See {@book Spells Rules|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the Wychlaran Spells Listing for your {@filter spell list|spells|class=Wychlaran (RCG)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wychlaran spell list|spells|class=Wychlaran (RCG)} spell list, as well as the {@spell guidance} and {@spell resistance} cantrips. You learn additional wychlaran cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Wychlaran Class Table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Wychlaran Class Table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your wychlaran spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of wychlaran spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the wychlaran spell list. The first time you do so, choose a number of wychlaran spells equal to your wychlaran level + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one spell). Subsequently, this total increases as your Wychlaran level or your Wisdom modifier increase, but you can only change a limited number of spells on the list per day as described below. Your prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can change a number of prepared spells equal to your Wisdom modifier when you finish a long rest, Preparing a new list of wychlaran spells requires time spent in ritual connection with the spirits or with the land: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level wychlaran, you have two 1st-level and one 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells. With a Wisdom modifier of +3, you can change 3 of the prepared spells on the list whenever you finish a long rest, they need not be the same spells you changed the previous day. The first time you prepare spells after leveling up to 4th level, you prepare one additional spell of your choice from the wychalaran spell list.

The Spell Slots Per Level columns indicate the number of spell slots available to cast per long rest, along with any bonded spell slots you may have available. The "+1" on this list represents the number of bonded spell slots available to you.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your witch spells, as your power comes from your study of the dark arts. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a witch spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a wychlaran spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have it prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use {@item sword|phb}, {@item quarterstaff|phb}, or a wychlaran mask as a spellcasting focus for your wychlaran spells.

classFeature.name: Communal Binding
entries: A wychlaran can perform a 1-hour ritual to create a bond between themself and a number of willing creatures. Excluding the wychlaran performing the ritual, the maximum number of creatures that can be included in the ritual is listed in the Communal Binding column in the Wychlaran Class Table. The Communal Binding number increases only with levels in the wychlaran class.

The communal bond lasts until the lead wychlaran performs a new binding ritual or through death. The communal bond is severed for all bonded creatures if the wychlaran dies, and for each individual bonded creature if they die. The ritual can be performed as part of a short or long rest, so long as the wychlaran does not cast spells while performing it. A wychlaran can't perform the Communal Binding ritual more than once every 24 hours.

When the Communal Binding ritual is completed, each bonded creature, including the wychlaran, contributes a number of d3s equal to their proficiency bonus to a communal pool. These dice are used when invoking the communal bindings' effects (see below) and tracked by the wychlaran who performed the ritual. The pool replenishes fully once all bonded creatures have completed a short rest.

The Communal Binding is a spiritual event and not considered magical, and is not affected by {@spell dispel magic} or similar effects. The communal pool is destroyed if the lead wychlaran dies or participates in a new Communal Binding.
{@b Communal Pool Uses}

items: As a bonus action on their turn, any of the bonded creatures can remove one die from the communal pool and add it to their next attack roll, damage roll, or ability check. They must choose the die's use when it is taken from the pool, and before rolling the pool die.

As a reaction when one of the bonded creatures makes a saving throw, that creature and/or the lead wychlaran who can see them can remove one die (each) from the pool and add it to the saving throw. They must do so after the saving throw has been rolled, but before determining the result.
As long as there is at least one die in the communal pool, a wychlaran can add that die to any saving throws made to maintain concentration without expending the die.

entries: {@b Multiple Wychlaran}

No creature, including a wychlaran, can be part of multiple bindings. A wychlaran can be part of a binding performed by another wychlaran; in this case, only one communal pool is formed, and it is controlled by the wychlaran leading the ritual. The binding of a second wychlaran increases the pool die size from d3 to d4, and the binding of a third wychlaran to a d6. Additionally, multiple wychlaran can never have the same Communal Channeling option active simultaneously within the same Communal Binding.
{@b Severed Bonds}

items: When a communal binding is severed as a result of the lead wychlaran's death, all participants suffer a 1d3 penalty to their attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and cannot participate in another Communal Binding until they finish a long rest. The communal pool is also destroyed.

When a communal binding is severed as a result of a bonded creature's death, only the lead wychlaran and that creature suffer the 1d3 penalty, but neither party suffers any Communal Binding restrictions.

classFeature.name: Bonded Casting
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can extend the benefits of certain spells to those you share a Communal Binding with. Casting in this manner is more strenuous than working normal spells, and only specific spells and separate spell slots can be used for Bonded Casting.
When you use Bonded Casting on your turn, you can take no other actions, bonus actions, or reactions during that turn.

When you use Bonded Casting to cast a spell targeting a creature with whom you share a Communal Binding, you may choose for that spell to affect any number of other creatures that are part of that Communal Binding.
{@b Bonded Spell Slots}

The Wychlaran Class Table shows how many bonded spell slots you have to cast your wychlaran spells of 1st level or higher. These spell slots can also be used for regular casting, but your regular spell slots cannot be used for Bonded Casting.

You regain all expended bonded spell slots when you finish a long rest. You can never gain more bonded spell slots than is listed on the Wychlaran Class Table, and items or features which add or restore spell slots do not add or restore bonded spell slots unless specified.
{@b Bonded Spells}
The Bonded Casting Spells table shows spells that can be used for bonded casting. You always have these spells prepared and they do not count against the number of spells you can prepare.

entries.caption: Bonded Casting Spells
rows: 2nd
{@spell guidance}, {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell healing word}, {@spell shield of faith}
4th
{@spell spider climb}
6th
{@spell spirit shroud|tce}
8th
{@spell freedom of movement}
10th
{@spell restore spirit|rcg}, {@spell tasha's otherworldly guise|tce}

entries: {@b Bonded Recovery}

Once per day, when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended bonded spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wychlaran level (rounded up).
For example, if you're a 4th-level wychlaran, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots. You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

classFeature.name: Communal Channeling
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your action to channel energies among those who are part of your Communal Binding, and are within 30 feet of you when the channeling begins. The channeling lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or you use an action on your turn to end it. When you begin channeling, you choose one of these options:

items: Commanding Channeling. You take tighter control of the Communal Binding. For the duration of the channeling, only you can use dice from the Communal Pool. Once on each of their turns, other creatures within the Communal Binding can deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier to a creature or creatures damaged by one of the bonded creature's spells or attacks.

Protective Channeling. You raise the defenses of the bonded creatures. When you begin channeling and at the start of each of their turns, this feature grants temporary hit points to all other creatures that are part of your Communal Binding. The number of temporary hit points is equal to your Communal Binding number. When a creature loses these temporary hit points, you take psychic damage equal to half your Communal Binding number, rounded down. If multiple creatures lose these hit points simultaneously, the total damage you take is capped at your Communal Binding number for that instance. Damage you take from Protective Channeling ignores resistance and immunity, but does not cause you to make saving throws to maintain concentration.

Psychic Channeling. You form a strong telepathic connection with the bonded creatures. For the duration of the channeling, all creatures within your Communal Bond can communicate telepathically, regardless of distance. The connection formed enables the affected creatures to perform more complex maneuvers by giving them awareness of what their comrades are about to do. Additionally, as a bonus action on their turn, a bonded creature can use the senses of another bonded creature instead of their own until the end of their own turn. For example, a human can gain a dwarf's darkvision.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis
entries: At 3rd level, you choose the set of teachings and customs you practice in your daily life as a wychlaran. The choice of praxis informs all aspects of your powers, from additional spells you learn from spirits, to how you lead your communal binding, to the way you use constructs. The Praxis of Tradition is the time-honored path for most hathrans, while the Praxis of Power is the nonconformist path typically taken by durthans.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Place Magic
entries: Starting at 5th level, you are able to draw on the magic of the land itself to help you cast your magics. While you are located in Rashemen, you can cast any wychlaran ritual spell without having it prepared.
Additionally, once per short rest, you can cast one wychlaran spell you don't have prepared using an appropriate spell slot.

classFeature.name: Unweave (1 use)
entries: The years of resistance and opposition to the Thayan wizards have taught the wychlaran to combat magic.

Starting at 6th level, you can use your action to cast {@spell dispel magic} at its lowest level, or your reaction to cast {@spell counterspell} at its lowest level, without using a spell slot, any components, or having the spell prepared.

Additionally, if the spell or effect you are attempting to unweave is of the necromancy or enchantment schools and requires you to make an ability check as part of casting {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell counterspell}, you can add your proficiency bonus to the ability check.
You may use this feature once and regain any expended uses when you finish a short rest. You gain additional uses of Unweave at 9th and 13th levels in this class.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain another feature from your Praxis.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Unweave (2 uses)
entries: You gain an additional use of Unweave at 9th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Repurpose Construct
entries: Starting at 10th level, ancient Raumatharian knowledge of constructs allows you to make use of existing constructs. When you defeat a construct and it is not entirely destroyed, you can attempt to magically re-purpose it to serve you. You can't attempt to repurpose a construct with a Challenge Rating greater than half your wychlaran level (rounded up).

The repurposing attempt takes 1 minute, during which you must remain within 5 feet of the construct and can't cast any spells. At the end of the minute, make a Wisdom (Arcana) check with a DC equal to 10 plus the construct's Challenge Rating. On failure, the construct is not re-animated and can't be targeted by this feature again.

On a success, you gain control of the construct, with the following changes: the construct no longer has its knowledge or personality, it has only half of its average hit points and can never regain hit points by any means short of a wish spell. It has an Armor Class 2 points lower than listed in its stat block. The construct acts immediately after you in initiative, and can move, dodge, and use any reactions on its own, but taking other actions requires you take a bonus action to command it to do so on its turn.

The construct is held together by magic and falls apart after 8 hours or earlier if you repurpose a different construct. Additionally, it can be destroyed by the {@spell dispel magic} spell or similar effects as a spell equal to its Challenge Rating.
Once you've successfully repurposed a construct, you can't do so again until you finish a short rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Unweave (3 uses)
entries: You gain an additional use of Unweave at 13th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain another feature from your Praxis.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain another feature from your Praxis.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Coven
entries: At 20th level, your Communal Binding can empower whole communities.

items: There is no longer a limit to the number of creatures that can be part of your Communal Binding.
When at least 6 other creatures are part of your Communal Binding, the Communal Pool has unlimited dice.
When at least 6 other creatures are part of your Communal Binding, other wychlaran within the binding can also use the pool as though they were the binding's leads.

entries: Having a 4th, 5th, or 6th wychlaran as part of your Communal Binding can now increase the Communal Pool die to a d8, d10, and d12 respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Secret Ways
entries: When you adopt the Praxis of Power at 3rd level, you become proficient in the Deception and Stealth skills.

subclassFeature.name: Praxis of Power
entries: The Praxis of Power lets you forge an independent path, seeking out hidden or forbidden knowledge to achieve your goals.
{@b Praxis Spells}

You gain praxis spells at the wychlaran levels listed in the Praxis of Power Spells table. You gain both standard and Bonded Casting spells from your praxis. Once you gain a praxis spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you have a praxis spell that doesn't appear on the wychlaran spell list, the spell is nonetheless a wychlaran spell for you.

entries.caption: Praxis of Tradition Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell bane}, {@spell dissonant whispers}, {@spell inflict wounds}, {@spell heat metal}, {@spell pass without trace}, {@spell phantasmal force}
5th
{@spell elemental weapon}, {@spell summon lesser demons}, {@spell summon shadowspawn}
7th
{@spell compulsion}, {@spell summon aberration}, {@spell summon greater demon}
9th
{@spell enervation}, {@spell infernal calling}
11th
{@spell blade barrier}, {@spell soul cage}

entries.caption: Praxis of Bonded Casting Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell shashkah|rcg}, {@spell longstrider}
4th
{@spell dragon's breath}
6th
{@spell haste}
8th
{@spell fire shield}

subclassFeature.name: Communal Channeling Enhancements
entries: Your Praxis of Power leads you to focus on harnessing personal power from your channeling. You learn to improve your communal channeling in subtle ways. An enhancement to each channeling option is available for you starting when you adopt this Praxis at 3rd level. You choose one of these options when you gain this feature, a second at 9th level, and the third at 11th level.
{@b Draw Power}
{@i Commanding Channeling Enhancement.}

While your Commanding Channeling is active, as a reaction when you deal damage, you can add the number of communal pool dice up to your communal binding number to the damage dealt by one of your attacks or wychlaran spells.
{@b Draw Protection}
{@i Protective Channelling Enhancement}

While your Protective Channeling is active, as a reaction when you take damage from an enemy, you can reduce the temporary hit points on any number of willing creatures in your Communal Binding to 0, and then reduce the damage you take by the same amount. The affected bonded creatures can't gain temporary hit points by any means until the start of your next turn.
{@b Masterplan}
{@i Psychic Channelling Enhancement}

When you roll initiative and you are not surprised, you can use your reaction to immediately begin your Psychic Channeling. Additionally, you may switch the initiatives of willing bonded creatures, including yourself, in any way you see fit.

subclassFeature.name: Demonstrate Power
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use the power you exude to dissuade others from hostile action. As an action, you can expend a spell slot of any level and attempt to threaten a creature with your arcane power.

If the creature's Challenge Rating is equal to or less than the level of slot expended, the creature refuses to take any action harmful to you and your allies for 24 hours and leaves the area unless it is in its lair or residence.

If however, the creature's Challenge Rating is higher than the level of the expended spell slot, for the next minute, you can use your reaction to the first hostile action by the creature against you or your allies to cast a spell with the previously expended spell slot;  the spell must have a regular casting time of 1 action, be of the same or lower level as the expended slot, and target only that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Personal Guardian
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you successfully repurpose a construct with a Challenge Rating of 7 or higher, you can repurpose it as a {@creature shield guardian} for yourself. The repurposed construct is subject to all penalties of the Repurpose Construct feature, including inability to regain hit points, but uses the {@creature shield guardian} statistics instead of the original construct's. The {@creature shield guardian} is bound to you and does not require a control amulet. Unlike a standard repurposed construct, the {@creature shield guardian} lasts until it is reduced to 0 hit points, is dispelled, or you repurpose a different construct.

subclassFeature.name: Place Power
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you finish a long rest in Rashemen, you can commune with the Rashemi spirits to begin the day with the {@spell gate} and {@spell meteor swarm} spells prepared. These spells count as wychlaran spells for you, and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare.

Alternatively, or if you are not in Rashemen, when you finish your long rest, you can commune with the local spirits. The DM chooses one spell of 7th or 8th level from any spell list that is relevant to either the theme or the former inhabitants of the region and you begin the day with this spell prepared; it counts a wychlaran spell for you, and does not count against the number of spells known. For example, communing with the spirits of the Plane of Fire may result in preparing the {@spell fire storm} spell, while communing with the spirits of a storm giant kingdom might result in {@spell control weather}. In the unlikely event that the location you're in has never been inhabited—such as a demiplane—this ability may yield no additional spells.

subclassFeature.name: Fortitude
entries: When you adopt the Praxis of Tradition at 3rd level, you learn traditional meditation techniques that fortify the body and spirit. Your hit point maximum increases by 3, and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Praxis of Tradition
entries: The Praxis of Tradition focuses on the protection and leadership of your people.

You gain praxis spells at the wychlaran levels listed in the Praxis of Tradition Spells table. You gain both standard and Bonded Casting spells from your praxis. Once you gain a praxis spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you have a praxis spell that doesn't appear on the wychlaran spell list, the spell is nonetheless a wychlaran spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Communal Channeling Enhancements
entries: You learn to improve your communal channeling in subtle ways. An enhancement to each channelling option is available for you starting when you adopt this Praxis at 3rd level. You choose one of these options when you gain this feature, a second at 9th, and the third at 11th level.
{@b Voice of Reason}
{@i Commanding Channeling Enhancement.}

While your Commanding Channeling is active, and you use a communal pool die on another creature, instead of using one die, you can use a number of dice equal to half your Communal Binding number (rounded up).
{@b Soothing Presence}
{@i Protective Channelling Enhancement}

While your Protective Channeling is active, the number of temporary hit points granted increases by your communal pool die. Additionally, you are resistant to psychic damage, including that dealt by your communal channeling.
{@b Burden of Leadership}
{@i Psychic Channelling Enhancement}

While your Psychic Channeling is active, as reaction at the start of your turn, you can choose to switch places in initiative with one bonded creature that has a lower initiative than you. The change in initiative lasts until the end of the combat. Once used, this feature can't be used again until the next time you roll initiative.

subclassFeature.name: Declare Presence
entries: Starting at 7th level, the weight of your presence is felt not only by the people of Rashemen, but by any intelligent creature. As an action, you speak your name and title (as appropriate) outloud. Your voice can be heard up to 60 feet away, including through nonmagical barriers such as stone up to 5 feet thick. For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Charisma checks made to interact with any creature that heard your declaration that has an Intelligence of 4 higher and speaks at least one language. Additionally, if you are surprised during this period, you do not lose the ability to use your reaction as a result of being surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Construct
entries: Starting at 14th level, you are able to use a construct under your control to protect your allies. As a reaction when a creature you can see is hit by an attack, you command your construct to intercept the attack. The construct must use its reaction to do so. If the construct is within 5 feet of the target, it takes twice the attack's damage. If the construct is more than 5 feet away, it may move up to its speed as part of its reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Place Wisdom
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you finish a long rest in Rashemen, you can commune with the Rashemi spirits to begin the day with the {@spell shapechange} and {@spell true resurrection} spells prepared. These spells count as wychlaran spells for you, and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare.
